descript.abstract: JumpStart International's January 2011 Georgia files have been exported from a central database built on the open source OpenStreetMap stack. All field work for this project was conducted during 2010 by JumpStart's 10 regional Georgia offices. The geographic coverage area for the complete data set is the entirety of the country of Georgia, excluding the two separatist regions of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. The files contain spatial information for a series of feature types. These features include country boundaries, road and rail network, landuse, hydrography, settlement points, and points of interest.
descript.purpose: JumpStart is publicly releasing data produced during its 2010 Georgia mapping project for use in geographic information systems, web applications, or for other geographic applications. Attribution is required in the form of "Data by JumpStart International" or as requested by JumpStart, unless explicit written permission is given otherwise. Web applications built for use within Georgia must also link to MapSpot.ge. Data usage is not limited by type of application and may be used for both commercial and non-commercial purposes. More information about future data sets may be obtained from JumpStart International.
descript.supplinf: The JumpStart Georgia Public Domain Data is based on its 2010 mapping project. Future updates and commercial versions may be available in the future. Contact JumpStart International for further information.

status.update: JumpStart Georgia files are extracted from its central database when substantial edits to the database have been made or when requested by partner organizations. No changes are planned for the Public Domain edition as of February 2011.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

idinfo.useconst: Although there are no restrictions on use for JumpStart Georgia Public Domain data, attribution is required in the form of "Data by JumpStart International" being clearly displayed on any product in which the data is included, except when explicit written permission is given otherwise. JumpStart International reserves the right to disallow usage of data for purposes that are considered illegal or contradict its organizational values. There are no restrictions on commercial use of the data so long as they meet the above requirements. Data derived from these files must also meet these requirements.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

attracc.attraccr: Attributes have been collected by field teams and verified from a variety of government and non-governmental sources. Due to the conflicts inherent between resources, complete accuracy is not guaranteed.

dataqual.logic: The following requirements have been validated through tests to ascertain logical consistency of the data: 1) Connecting roads must connect at nodes 2) Non-overlapping segments do not overlap 3) Polygons are closed Features have been examined for topological and attribute accuracy, though have not been fully tested.
dataqual.complete: Data is considered complete for all regions of Georgia. This does not include breakaway regions of Abkhazia and South Ossetia.

horizpa.horizpar: JumpStart International uses consumer grade Global Positioning System *GPS" devices to collect coordinates for road centerlines and points of interest. This provides a locational accuracy of +/- 10 meters. With rectified aerial imagery covering 90% of the country, GPS tracks and points are combined with imagery to achieve even higher accuracy. In the mountainous regions of Mestia and Mtianeti, data was collected without imagery and with higher GPS error ranges of +/- 15 meters.

srcinfo.srccontr: Selected geographic data from the JumpStart International OMC database.

procstep.procdesc: Selected features have been extracted from the JumpStart International OMC geographic database, which is built on the OpenStreetMap technology stack. Data is initially exported from the database to OSM XML, and then converted into Shapefile format. Data collection was conducted by teams of mappers updating the central database between September 2009 and January 2010. Nationwide aerial imagery and GPS tracks were used for geographic accuracy and field work was conducted nationwide to ascertain accurate attributes.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: A small residential street where few cars transit
A pedestrian path found in a city
A pedestrian way typically in the countryside
A "local" road which is predominated by homes. Not a main or arterial road.
A main road, typically linking large towns or connecting a large city.
Typically a main road within a city boundary.
Typically a main road in a small town or a small highway linking smaller towns.
Pedestrian steps, usually found in cities.
A small street typically used as access in industrial or large commercial areas.
A large highway. In Georgia only the new highway linking Tbilisi and Gori.
Related to a residential road in size and conditions, but with few or no homes.

overview.eaover: JumpStart's Georgia files contain data describing the following features: Line Features: 1) District Boundaries 2) City/Town Boundaries 3) Tbilisi Districts 4) Roads 5) Railroads 6) Hydrography 7) Greenspace (parks, grass, cemeteries - sporadic coverage primarily in cities) Point Features: 1) Settlement Points 2) Landmarks (points of interest) 3) Transportation (railway stations/airports)

distinfo.resdesc: JumpStart International Georgia Public Domain Geodata
distinfo.distliab: No warranty either expressed or implied is made with regard to the accuracy of this data, and no liability is assumed by JumpStart International or its local implementation organizations for the spatial or attribute accuracy of the data. The act of distribution does not constitute such a warranty and JumpStart International does not assume responsibility for the use of these files. Boundary information contained in the JumpStart Georgia Public Domain files are for tabulation purposes only and do not constitute an official determination of jurisdictional authority or rights of ownership of entitlement and they are not legal land descriptions.

stdorder.fees: The JumpStart Georgia files may be accessed online without charge.

distinfo.techpreq: JumpStart Georgia files contain geographic data only and do not include display or mapping software. Relevant software applications may be required to view the data.

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
